climbs.name: Unknown left of Slice of Death

content.protection: Lots of permadraws and maybe 5 of your own draws for the bottom. 8/2/2019.
content.location:
It is to the left of

Slice of Death

.

content.description: This is the first climb in the Gash on the left as you hike into the canyon. It climbs the streaked shield of granite for 3 bolts before a traverse to the right to the fourth bolt (avoid climbing off route to the left). This climb starts hard and then eases off at the top. Get your warm-up in first. The climbing is steep, tricky, and sustained on good rock.

Climb right-trending seams with some face relief up a steep, black wall.

This route is an exercise in finesse rather than power.   Start by compressing between the crack and some face holds until you reach a decent rest at mid-height.  The second half is a bit harder and with less face holds the route forces you to layback and gaston the crack until you reach another decent hold.  Veer left, hug the seam and the arete, and lunge for a very satisfying jug just below the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the second route from the top before you reach the Pink Wall.  Look for a fixed rope which helps you reach the base of the climb.

content.description:
Start in cave above terraces, and locate the left wall where you will find your first bolt. This has tricky and exciting climbing. Hal way up the climb, a sharp fin of rock will pass dangerously close to your nether regions, meet the Mohels Mazeltov. It is short and plenty stout. Warm up first. This is harder than it looks. There are lots of drop knees and hidden holds. It shares anchors with

Cheese and Rice

.

The start is 15 feet uphill and to the right of the

Tartarus

. Large holds lead to a steep, short, inch wide splitter crack. Pull through the crack with a sidepull to jugs, then continue straight up a bullet face with shallow left to right crack. The crux is just left of obvious bonsai tree. Please be careful of tree. The original start of Fasting on Ramadan is in the gully/ramp  to the right of

Tartarus

start. The left start is an option, but the direct start is more fun. This is particularly solid for the area!
content.protection: The direct start uses 7 bolts and has a fixed anchor.

content.description:
This climb starts 40 feet uphill of

Fasting on Ramadan

. Start in cave and step left onto left-trending slab. At top of the slab, continue straight up to anchors. Easy climbing builds to crux in black rock right before anchors.

This climb is a good way to top rope The Mohels Mazeltov and hang draws. It is the easiest climb in the entire Gash. The climb would be a 5.8 if it wasn't for the final crux move. To avoid the crux, it is possible to skip the last bolt and climb left to the

Fasting on Ramadan

anchors.
